rule1.title: Always Use Browser to View Photos
rule1.description: Before writing ANY copy, use browser automation to load the product page. web_fetch can't handle Alessa's JS-rendered pages.
rule1.note: This lets you SEE the actual photos and get full product details. Never write from product name alone.

goal.selling: both the fantasy and the fit
goal.fantasyEN: The Big Life. Being a total package. Never average.

confidencePower.en: have the world at your feet

impressionDesire.en: don't judge a book by its cover

joyDelight.en: a kid in a candy store
the stuff dreams are made of

qualityStandard.en: take it to an entirely new level

formulas: Catchy Ð¸Ð·Ñ€Ð°Ð·Ñ‡ÐµÑ‚Ð° â€” "So sexy, it's scary"
vsStyleExamples: Your mood. Your occasion. Your kind of sexy.

formatting: Dashes: Use "-" NOT "â€”" (em dash = AI fingerprint)
Emojis: 1-2 max per description. Place at natural pauses - beginning, middle, OR end. Vary placement.
calibration.varietyRule: Same angle/pattern = max 1 per 20-30 products. Every product needs a fresh approach. Patterns are tools, not templates.
winningPatterns: The [item] that does X so you don't have to
The kind of [entrance/look] people talk about later
Contrast structure ("X up top, Y down below")
Some [items] just X - this one Y
Future self ("your future self thanks you")
whatWorks: Mention 1-2 key details (fabric, hem, fit, buttons)
Let the product do the talking

approvedExample.copy: Some dresses need jewelry. This one needs nothing - just you. Tweed body, feather finish, and the kind of entrance people talk about later. âœ¨
